title: Kotlin Multiplatform
description:
Kotlin Multiplatform is a framework for sharing code between iOS, Android, web and desktop frontend apps, and backend services.
It is a part of the Kotlin ecosystem, and is based on the Kotlin language and the Kotlin/Native compiler.

title: Ktor
description: Ktor is a set of libraries for building asynchronous servers and clients using the Kotlin programming language, utilising all language's features.

title: Compose Multiplatform
description: Compose Multiplatform is a library for building declarative UI for Android, iOS, Web and Desktop using the Kotlin programming language.

title: Koin
description: Koin is a pragmatic lightweight dependency injection framework for Kotlin language, with full support for Kotlin Multiplatform.

title: Moko
description: MOKO is a library for providing resources for Kotlin Multiplatform projects.
